data.title: The terminal process command `C:\Windows\sysnative\cmd.exe` failed to launch (exit code: 1)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Win10 64Bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open `Integrated Terminal`

I tried to reinstall Code but still cannot open the terminal.

Then I found that it only happened when I install on the default path
`C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code`

`C:\Code` or `C:\Program Files (x86)\Code` is ok
and portable version is ok too.

data.title: node.js debug issue
data.body:
debug the node.js projects via nodemon failed

- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-insider
- OS Version: windows7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. change the default integrated terminal to git bash
2. debug node.js projects via nodemon
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5064875/22675305/e3b7dddc-ed1f-11e6-881a-021ec426c63a.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5064875/22675158/f8fab760-ed1e-11e6-9a6a-dd591646e969.png)

3. it works when i change the default integrated terminal back to cmd
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5064875/22675295/da9c11e6-ed1f-11e6-94f8-e4234edec074.png)

4. it doesn't work when i change the console option to `internalConsole` either
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5064875/22675351/21c92892-ed20-11e6-89d0-d6a77207346b.png)

data.title: Disable Paren Commit Item When useCodeSnippetsOnMethodSuggest is Enabled
data.body:
**bug**
`(` was added as a commit character in 1.9. Combined with `useCodeSnippetsOnMethodSuggest`, this is causing some anoying autocomplete behavior.

**Fix**
Disable `(` as a commit character while `useCodeSnippetsOnMethodSuggest` is enabled. 

This is a scoped workaround for #19820. We'll revisit `useCodeSnippetsOnMethodSuggest` in 1.10

data.title: Improve Markdown Preview Code Block Styling
data.body: Fixes #7776 **Bug** Indented code blocks in the markdown preview are not very good looking **Fix** Use default text color for indented code blocks and add a background # Before # After

data.title: Cursor becomes invisible
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Switch between tabs.

When switching between tabs, the editing cursor becomes invisible. I can usually get it to show up again if I select some text, but even that sometimes doesn't work. I tried setting "editor.disableMonospaceOptimizations" to true, as mentioned in the release notes, but VSCode insists that it's not a valid option (and it doesn't seem to help, anyway).

Happy to provide more information if needed!

data.title: Debug Console only shows output written to stderr (node2)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Only `stderr` is showing on the Debug Console when using the `node2` debug adapter. Anything written to `stdout` (i.e. by `process.stdout.write() used by winston`) is missing. Seems to have been introduced with 1.9.0.

Here is the launch config I use:
```json
        {
            "type": "node2",
            "request": "launch",
            "name": "Launch Program",
            "program": "${workspaceRoot}\\server\\main.js",
            "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
            "sourceMaps": true,
            "smartStep": true,
            "internalConsoleOptions": "openOnSessionStart"
        }
```
Using `"type": "node"` instead shows output written to `stdout` just fine.

data.title: Open containing window
data.body: @bpasero Could you take a quick look? I believe this is what we discussed for #15654. Thanks.

data.title: Debug hangs immediately on powershell script
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.0 (27240e71ef390bf2d66307e677c2a333cebf75af, 2017-02-02T08:31:00.827Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.2.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.10|

---
After updating to v1.9.0, no scripts run, either in single file or normal debug sessions.  The progress bar runs until I cancel it (requires two clicks on the cancel button), but no output occurs to the debug console.  Tried it on two computers.
Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new powershell script.  Folder can be open or not.  Debug clicked or not.
2. Type Write-Host 'Test'
3. Press F5 or click the Run icon.  No output displays.  Script never completes.

|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open folder on a mapped drive (in this case the mapped drive is to a SharePoint 365 site)
2. Receiving a recurring message about Typescript failing

data.title: Hitting enter to insert a new line at the end of a comment triggers autocomplete
data.body:
Not sure if this is a dupe of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/10819 or not?

- VSCode Version: Version 1.9.0 (1.9.0)
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type a comment and type to the end of a line
2. Type a word that has an autocompletion you don't want
3. Hit enter to start a new line
![vscode-autocomplete](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/79215/22671641/32095070-ec84-11e6-9df3-3d387d6e4d50.gif)

data.title: Application opening without file opening
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set VS Code as Windows default app for .cs files
2. Double click a .cs file in Windows Explorer

VS Code will open, but the .cs file you double clicked on will not be one the open tabs. You see Untitled-1 instead.
See animated gif. Note that the animated gif is looped.

Further notes- I repro'ed this without any VS Code extensions. I also reset settings to default before repro'ing.

![vs code bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2722806/22671851/5166feee-ec85-11e6-8468-91197002cb64.gif)



Note: Updating from 1.8 to 1.9 did not solve the issue. Uninstalling and reinstalling solved the issue.

data.title: Broken Square Select (Multiple Cursor Select)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Key Down Shift + Alt
2. Click to the right of X in the last line
3. Select to the S of SoMEKEy
At the moment nothing is selected
4. Go to the E of valuE

This is what it select :
SomeKey" valuE
SomeKey" value
SomeKey" value

What it should be selected: 
E="000
e="000
e="00X


Example of file :
```
<property id="SomeThing" key="SomeKey" value="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" key="SomeKey" value="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" Key="SomeKey" value="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" key="SomeKey" value="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" key="SoMEKEy" value="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" key="SomeKey" value="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" key="SomeKey" value="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" key="SomeKey" valuE="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" key="SomeKey" value="000"/>
<property id="SomeThing" key="SomeKey" value="00X"/>
```

data.title: A repository of problemMatchers for common (or less common tools)
data.body:
There are any number of common tools, language outputs, compilers, linters, test outputs etc.

A developer will probably need selection of flavours of problemMatchers for use in tasks.json to cover these.

The proposal is to create repo or list of problem matchers, where people can contribute and enhance them.

This could be as simple as a set of searchable pages people can make PR's to and add ones that they didn't find. It could later be expanding into something suggested in VSCode.

- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a folder with a new git repo initialized
2. `touch "\\"`
3. Open the directory with VS Code
4. VSCode continues loading forever

2. Press Command-A
3. Observe nothing happens.

data.title: Stop TS From Spamming Crash Messages
data.body:
**Bug**
When the tsserver crashes repeatedly, it can end up spamming users with constant alerts. This is not too helpful

**Fix**
A number of small fixes:

* Set lastStart on boot to handle cases where tsserver crashes right away without ever starting successfully 
* Lengthen 5 crash timeout to 10 seconds from 2 seconds. 5 crashes in 10 seconds == no attempted restart
* Reset the last started time when we have any number of crashes in the row. This resets the crash windows.
* Fix any crash after the fifth retriggering the same alert. I believe the intent was that we should show these errors every five crashes, not on any crash after the fifth one
